alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Nemaha; Otoe; Pawnee (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 20 at 1:21AM CDT until April 20 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Johnson County in southeastern Nebraska... Nemaha County in southeastern Nebraska... Southeastern Otoe County in southeastern Nebraska... Northeastern Pawnee County in southeastern Nebraska... * Until 200 AM CDT. * At 120 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northeast of Lewiston, or 10 miles southwest of Tecumseh, moving northeast at 25 mph. Another severe thunderstorm was located near Julian, also moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Elk Creek around 140 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Tecumseh, Johnson and Cook. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
